name: Coconut Chikki
summary: Sweets are a centerpiece of the Punjabi agricultural festival Lohri, and coconut chikki is definitely a favorite. So here's a quick idea for your Lohri feast, and you won't even have to place a few calls to Pakistan to get the recipe.
ingredients: ¼ cup water, or as needed
directions: Melt 1 tablespoon of ghee to a pan over low heat; add coconut and roast until lightly browned, about 2 minutes
Add brown sugar to a skillet over medium heat and slowly mix in sugar
Put in a glug of water, increase heat, and bring to a boil, about 3 minutes, stirring constantly
Lower the heat, stirring constantly until the mixture starts to solidify, about 2 minutes
Add coconut and mix in until well combined
Transfer mixture to a greased sheet pan or baking dish and spread out
Cut immediately into squares or rectangles and allow to cool completely
Take the coconut you put aside earlier and add it to the mixture, mix well so the coconut is evenly spread throughout the sugar Pour the mixture into a pan and allow to firm up
